result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian John Oshaughnessy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
based on statute 973.09(2)(a)1.b the Def may be put on probation for a period of 2 years. 
Provide DNA sample.
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.

3:49  Defendant Brian John Oshaughnessy in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Craig Theis is also present from DOC.  Court Costs  are owed. Court grants a  judgment (DO NO ENTER JUDGMENT) for the coourt costS. The Judge will give the defendant 1 year to make payments of $50.00 per month.  Calender for review 1 year out for Judge to review the payments.
Probation review hearing on October 23, 2018 at 03:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian John Oshaughnessy in court with attorney Tracy R. Eichhorn-Hicks.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Todd Kenyon appeared in court with Def. Atty OSullivan: moves to amend charge to misd. battery and Def will plea guilty to amended information.  Atty Kenyon and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Atty Osullivan will file an amended information. Def pleas guilty amended charge of misd battery; Kenyon stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended Ct#1 of misd. battery. OSullivan and Kenyon address sentening. Court: S/W 2 years conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, any conditions imposed by Agent.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
No abusive contact.
Plea hearing on November 21, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Atty Eichhorn-Hicks requests the no contact be removed.  Janelle Foley speaks to the court and asks the court to lift the no contact.

3:55 Defendant Brian John Oshaughnessy in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared via phone.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullivan: cash bond no with no contact. Nelson objects and request a signature bond.  Court orders a signature bond. Court goes over the bond conditions. If the Def is released he will not be eligible for a PD.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.
